Reviews.Title: “Eveything is ok”
Reviews.Author: aliciatrip
Reviews.Content: Good location. We had a clean, quiet and nice room. Parking ok. Very comfty king size bed ! May be missing some arrangements and a hair dryer in the room. But it's a good hotel, effective. We had a good stay. OK. I recommend it. Good location. We had a clean, quiet and nice room. Parking ok. Very comfty king size bed ! May be missing some arrangements and a hair dryer in the room. But it's a good hotel, effective. We had a good stay. OK. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Place”
Reviews.Author: KRISTY H
Reviews.Content: It's located in downtown Los Angeles in the middle of Koreatown. My boyfriend and I stay at this place every time we visit. I have to admit, I have high maintenance, and this place always meets my needs. It has the most comfortable king size bed and the people who work there are so kind. They even remember you each time you stay there! The hotel is clean which is very important to me. The price isn't too bad either. They seem to be doing great business. Last time we visited, they were planning on building a pool on the rooftop. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Amelia B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, close to the metro station and a supermarket. The rooms were very clean and tastefully furnished. The walls are bare but we ranked comfort and cleanliness above decoration! The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom had a great shower. Very modern and well-equipped. Our only quibbles were the lack of bar soap to wash hands (but they gave us extra body wash when we asked) and the noise bleed-through from the room above... but I think our neighbours above were exceptionally noisy so it won't always be the case. Very helpful staff, they stored our luggage for us for the day of departure. Cupcakes and coffee were available in the lobby for breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, HORRIBLE valet and night service”
Reviews.Author: deniseduong
Reviews.Content: Its nice that they offer parking, but when the garage is full they have a valet guy. Geez, he just snatched the keys from my hand when I pulled in that evening and didn't say a word what he was doing. Luckily I had stayed there before and already knew, but a new comer would be utterly confused. He was over the top rude and uninformative. Oh, no worries, its just some stranger snatching keys out of my hand and driving off with my car. Second, I walked to a near by restaurant to have a late night dinner and when I came home, the gate to the parking garage was closed. The front door was locked! No way to get into the hotel. NO WAY!!! So I climbed the garage gate and jumped over the top and let myself in. I went up to talk to the person in charge. It was pitch black in the lobby with one lamp on at a desk with the same valet guy full of attitude and hate. I WILL NEVER stay here again. NEVER. I had high hopes when I first set foot in the room, but then the sun fell and moon rose, and out came the service.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE.”
Reviews.Author: oafc84
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights , end of Nov, prior to our son's wedding. This was our 2nd stay at the Shelter and found the rooms very clean. The staff ,especially Jason (the manager) and Stephen (deputy) were so friendly and courteous..On both occasions , when we arrived after a long flight from England , we were offered coffee before we'd even checked in. We have stayed in more expensive Hotels which are nowhere near as clean as the Shelter.We prefer the dark floorboards rather than carpets, which often become stained in hotel rooms. We find it very convenient for public transport as we don't hire a car in LA and there are some good eating places around.Jason & Stephen will happily print off any thing you might need from the Internet. The WiFi connection is excellent and free of charge. The only minus ,in our opinion , is there are no safes in the rooms.The management do offer to place your valuables in their safe , which is a help but not ideal. We plan on staying again this autumn.

Reviews.Title: “If old school Hollywood and contempoary Downtown LA had a love child...”
Reviews.Author: Villagetom
Reviews.Content: So we come to LA for business about every 6 weeks and happen to find this hotel in its infancy- we have seen it grow from bare bones. We did not score it a "5" in all areas because it is a work in progress, but what it lacks in amenities and location it totally makes up for in service and price AND the beds are super comfy. We are out of our rooms all day so what's most important to us is safety and a goods night sleep- the covered garage, which they lock at night was a bonus- parking is free. There us never an issue with our requests and "everyone knows our name" hats off to you all! Jason, the GM has an awesome grasp on hospitality and has never disappointed. We will continue to book our stays with them with the level of service they provide.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a night's stay”
Reviews.Author: shipwrecked415
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Shelter for one night at a very reasonable rate. Amenities are pretty basic -- there's water and coffee available in the lobby. There's a coffee maker, toiletries, free wifi, free parking, and cable. Unfortunately, it seems the hotel is still a work in progress. I know they are most likely aiming for a "minimalist" or zen feel but I think in part it's because they have not taken the time to think about their space. For one, there is no other lighting options in the room besides the overhead light - not even a desk lamp. The room also felt empty and not very cozy. For such a large room it could have used a love seat or small lounge chair, maybe a rug to warm the room up a bit. Pros Free Wifi Free Parking ( although it gets full in the evening so you have to leave your keys at the concierge) Comfortable bed Nice bathroom Central location Reasonable nightly rate Cons Minimalist rooms to the point of uncoziness No room service No breakfast weak coffee You have to call the desk if you want entry late night while outside

Reviews.Title: “Worths a try...”
Reviews.Author: Kirman
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Spacious room, - Comfy bed, - Neat bathroom (fixtures are new but need a bit of care), - Wireless work well, - Desk (Steve?) kind and genial, - Korean town seemed the safest in the city - Close to metro and bus routes - 5 mins walk to Zion Market Cons: - A/C is noisy, - Breakfast is only coffee and muffins (or cookies) served on an easel (Cake House Cafe in Zion Market is perfect place for breakfast) Overall: Worths the price, satisfied...

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable price but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: nurg
Reviews.Content: Comfortable bed. Internet was fine, both wired & wireless. Was a good location for me (without car), with easy access to train and buses, and food places nearby. Was not as quiet as I wanted, with lots of sound on the floor above and in the corridor coming through, and some noise from vehicles on the street. The woman who checked me in was very pleasant but did not say anything about breakfast coffee and (non-nutritious) food in the lobby. I only knew about it from reviews. When the young man was on duty he offered me milk for the coffee, but the woman never did. Prior to when they lock the external door at night anyone could walk off the street into the corridors, so be sure to lock your room. The chain on my door came right off the door jamb, but that didn't bother me. I didn't stay out after they locked the doors but would have had a problem if I did as I didn't have my mobile phone with me. I thought it was a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Defiantly need to hire a car while in LA!”
Reviews.Author: Jessking87
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and big, bed was comfy but the shower was never very hot and really crappy pressure. Rooms don't have a bar fridge or hair dryer which was very inconvenient. Good cable tv channel and never had any problems with the wifi. As someone mentioned in a previous review, they lock the doors after a certain time and have no way to let you in. Arrived at 3am from a night out and was locked out, lucky someone else arrived in a car so the gates opened. The food on nearby 6th in Korea town is yummy, but never really felt very safe walking around even during the day. Steve who works on the desk was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “should be called "Homeless Shelter Motel"”
Reviews.Author: SFLASf
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week on business in October 2011. There is no ways that it is a 3-star accommodation. I'd rate it 1 star, if that. While the staff are nice, the place is extremely run down, poorly taken care of, and not very clean. Examples: stains on the sheets and the walls, holes in the walls, paper-thin walls, clear maintenance issues in the stairwells, etc. Even if you're just sleeping here, it's not worth it. (and I'm not picky) fyi, this place is not truly non-smoking as they allow guests to smoke outside their rooms in the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: vjl330
Reviews.Content: We chose Shelter because it was just 3 blocks from friends we were visiting.When we reserved the room we requested a fridge.After a quick check-in it was not in the room but we called and it was delivered quickly.It was much larger than the usual hotel room.As you can tell by the name,it was kind of stark.No dressers,no towel racks,no lamp on the desk.But they do have Directv and I slept well on the king bed.We've been to Koreatown a few times and it's a relatively safe area and the hotel is close to public transportation.If you don't like Asian food your choices are a McDonalds or Denny's on Wilshire. Shelter was different,but I got used to the lack of amenities.For us,the location is so convenient it's a sure thing we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good place!”
Reviews.Author: Leonardo T
Reviews.Content: Very good location, helpful staff. Large and comfortable rooms. I recommend this hotel! But make sure you have a car in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Crisw300
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights and had a very large, clean and comfortabel hotel. We chose the hotel because it was cheap and we only use hotels for the night - we leave early in the morning and return after dinner. We travelled with our 7 y.o. child and were happy with the Shelter. We had a car so it was no trouble to drive to various parts of LA. The hotel is basic but staff were super courteous and tried to help wit everything we asked. Bedroom and bathroom were very clean. The only thing we lacked was a fridge. The beds were very comfortable as well. Linen was a bit old but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a haven in LA!”
Reviews.Author: Saintlysinner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2010. Our final stop was in LA. we stayed at the Shelter because it was cheap in comparison to other hotels and the location was great! The name of the hotel at first did put me off. But when we arrived, we were promptly checked it. they had an underground car park which was a great bonus. The room itself was very clean and modern. However it does need a few things to make it look a bit more finished and homely. I can't praise the staff at this hotel enough. they are SO friendly and always take the time out to help you out. One of the girls working there- Tango, was fab. she was so helpful and recommended a fantastic Thai restaurant (it's the best Thai food I have had, outside Thailand). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great start to our trip”
Reviews.Author: Gristy58
Reviews.Content: we booked here due to all the hotels near the la live being sold out. hotel is in the heart of korea town anr only a short walk from the 720 cross town bus. rooms were huge and staff friendly. free wifi as well.

Reviews.Title: ““ehhhh – at the right price it’s okay””
Reviews.Author: zsuzu
Reviews.Content: In summary: I paid less than $75/night for a king room. At that price this hotel was a reasonable value considering the various pluses (location and price) and minuses (overall quality of experience). This is definitely not a 'hotel' experience but at the right price it would be a reasonable trade-off if you are prepared and informed. Location: The hotel location is pretty convenient for getting around and it’s close to a red/purple line train station. There are no good restaurants in the immediate area so you need to drive to eateries and entertainment. This is an apartment building converted into hotel rooms. Room and condition: I had a top floor corner king room and the room was reasonably clean and quiet(ish) – it’s definitely an urban location with the associated noise but that’s the location. The feel/look is modern but the finishes are budget and are showing wear and tear already. They have added hooks and towel ladder in the bathroom so there is now somewhere for towels (but the hook was loose on the wall). I wasn’t impressed with the polyester (60%) / cotton (40%) sheets – in hot weather who wants to sleep on the equivalent of plastic wrap. There were four light bulbs burnt out in my room at check-in. The general level of service and my not caring much about light levels is why I didn’t report the burnt out bulbs – all I’d say is that I’m surprised housekeeping never noticed. I did advise the desk at check-out so they could deal with it before the next guest. Service: Front desk is always staffed and staff were friendly however this is definitely not a “hotel” experience. The staff were young (and seemed inexperienced) and usually unable to help with questions like “is there a mailbox nearby?”, “how much is the bus?”, or “is the wifi down?”. There is no hotel safe/lock box and nothing in the rooms so if you are an international guest be prepared to drag your passport around LA with you. Complaint: I emailed the hotel multiple times before travelling to find out how they handled late night check-ins – none of my 4 emails received a response and I was using the email link on the hotel web-site. I finally phoned and was told that it was no problem – the front desk was always staffed and I could just check-in. Unfortunately what they did not tell me is the ‘front desk’ is on the second floor of the hotel and that they lock the hotel at night and there is no doorbell/buzzer. I nearly traveled without my cellphone – thank goodness I had it with me as you have to CALL the hotel to get in so you can check-in. Some more detailed information about late night check in would have been helpful. When I got in the staff member on duty told me I should have beeped my car horn – at 1:30 am, inches from the hotel where people were sleeping. Not impressed. Misc: Internet/wifi was constantly weak and I kept losing the signal – there is no good location in the hotel were you will get a stronger signal (I did ask – repeatedly). Parking – not enough spaces for the number of rooms so whenever they are full – like weekends – you will end up double parked and must leave your keys with the front desk for them to move your car as needed.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly ok”
Reviews.Author: Amtex
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok, room and hotel facilities are basic. The staff are friendly and helpful with stupid tourist questions. It's a bit out of the way, $35 cab ride to Hollywood or the Sunset Strip. Generally I was happy as I got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone.”
Reviews.Author: MichelleRjordan
Reviews.Content: I come to LA often on business and I wouldn't stay anywhere else. The price, comfort, cleanliness, location, and service can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Hollywood attractions, hotel was so-so”
Reviews.Author: Jamesah108
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay here from the pictures on the website. The decor is slick and modern but the room was bare and boring. Nothing on the walls but a flat screen that I couldn't get to work. There was a desk in the room that was very wobbly. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was nice...two very important things to me. There was nowhere to hang up clothes (no closet). I asked reception and they brought an armoire into the room for me very quickly. The hallways of the hotel smell a little like mold at first. Maybe it was just the humidity in the air. Not sure. There's gated underground parking, which fills up late at night so you have to leave your keys with reception so you don't block anyone in. The hotel is under construction but I didn't notice any noise at all, just a little dust and various areas under construction. There was an apartment building right outside my window. There were three or four balconies that could see right into my room very easily...that was kind of a drag. The location is great. Super close to anything you want to do in Hollywood. I would probably stay again as long as it was a discounted rate. It will probably be a 3-star hotel if they spruce it up a little when the construction is done. Right now, I'd give it 2.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall but lacking amenities”
Reviews.Author: Shmol
Reviews.Content: In terms of location, this hotel is just great. It's located in Korea town and is virtually next door to Beverly Hills. There are some very nice Korean and Japanese restaurants within a walking distance and the area is very clean (for LA standards) and safe at night. Our room was equipped with a large and very comfrortable bed, so the sleep quality was just like in our own bed at home. The flat screen tv was great and had the most impressive selection of channels (over 300). The Wi-Fi was free and available in room, which was a big bonus in a big city like LA. Parking was offered free of charge as well in a secured underground garage. Despite all these pros there were also some cons. This hotel is under constant renovations. When we stayed there, their lobby was being renovated and the staff worked out of a tiny area just in front of the lift.. Also our room had no fridge, no microwave, not even a simple tea pot. There was no phone and no room service. But overall we were still happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Rather disappointing but we would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: christiana_eva
Reviews.Content: Location The hotel sits at the Korean district in a quiet neighborhood. It is mostly surrounded with houses and you will need a car to get to most of the good restaurants or cafes around the district as well as to Hollywood. The car is a must option once you decide to stay at this hotel and if the reason of you visiting the city is for sightseeing since taxis are nowhere to be seen even if you reach the closest avenue which is Wilshire (5 minute walk). Buses run from Wilshire too but you need to know where you’re going and be well informed. That is not a problem of the hotel but obviously of the city that does not provide any convenient transportation services whatsoever. The hotel was recently renovated, as all of the reviews and the hotel’s website claimed, so we booked a double room for 2 nights on a special 2+1 night’s price. The hotel’s sign though is not even visible from outside and both the rooms and building need a serious makeover. Room The room was cozy and big but literally empty! That didn’t really discourage us but there are very essential things missing from their rooms. There is free Wi-Fi available as long as you ask for the password! They don’t provide any room service or breakfast but they make a really warm gesture by offering coffee and cupcakes every morning at the front desk. We also encountered a problem with the elevator which doors didn’t shut easily and that was a bit annoying. The hotel’s architectural structure was really odd and we couldn’t find our room easily. All in all the hotel looks like it is a friendly family run business with little to limited amenities and services but certainly worth staying for the price we paid and the generally ridiculously overpriced hotels in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been better but...”
Reviews.Author: E L
Reviews.Content: My 6 night stay was actually decent. The place was unfinished, but my room was really big and empty which I don't mind. I liked the hardwood floors and the extra empty space for my luggage. The bathroom needed a few more hooks to hang my clothes. No safe in the room, I wish they had one. Free parking was nice but the space was limited and sometimes you have to double park. All in all, it was really just a place to stay at night with my boyfriend after a long day at the convention we were attending near by, and I guess this hotel served it purpose. Unfortunately, the unpleasant experience was this situation here. Once I was there, I was asked to place a deposit, which was pretty standard. However I did not have my credit card with me so I decided to pay my deposit in cash instead. On the day of my check out, the front desk apparently didn't have $100 cash with them. I didn't have a credit card to refund to and I had a flight to catch so they asked me to leave my address and said that they'd mail me a check. 2 weeks passed, I haven't received my check. So I had my boyfriend who lives in LA follow up the situation. Finally got a hold of the manager after another 2 weeks of trying and the manager asked for my address again and my email, telling me that he will email me the tracking number once the check has been sent. Another 2 weeks have gone by, and I didn't receive a single email, no tracking number, and no check. It has been total of 7 weeks now and I have yet to see this check or tracking number.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: TimBrooksbank
Reviews.Content: Quirky hotel in a residential area. Don't go there if you expect to be waited on and have lots of staff being nice to you in the hope of a tip, but if you want to deal with genuinely friendly staff in a good value hotel with nice rooms and awesomely comfortable beds then this is the place. It has its quirks, such as sometimes you have to ask for the aircon wall unit to be fixed and sometimes the TV remotes just don't work or are missing, but these are minor and are attended to when you ask. Overall the rooms a large and pleasant and best of all there's parking without the usual ridiculous LA parking fees and expectation of a parking tip. I've been many times and keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 with hardwood floors.”
Reviews.Author: jb7706
Reviews.Content: The bad: Security cameras there just for show, none worked. Hotel is unfinished, lights are missing trim, walls missing fixtures. My room had a security chain that was hanging on by one screw, there was an unknown sticky substance inside the entry on the floor. The bathroom floor had not been mopped in who knows how long. There was a layer of heavy dust and misc bits of refuse on floor under the bed. No art on the walls, furniture had been stolen/removed. No coffee maker, no instructions on the phone, not even a number to give to family, but not such a big deal with everyone owning a cell phone. No restaurant, room service, business center. I did not feel at all safe in my room and was very happy I had personal protection. The good: No bedbugs, bedding and linens clean. Bathroom fixtures clean and serviceable. Staff are friendly and helpful. Internet access was fast and reliable. Parking was free, but if another guest double parks the front desk staff have to move cars around to get you out. TV worked and had a good selection of channels. AC worked if a bit loud. I knew this was in Korea Town and went in knowing it may be an "adventure" after looking at the area on Google street view. This is a very basic hotel, no frills and the neighborhood is urban residential. I would not have my wife or kids stay with me there. It's fine if you don't have other options, but I'd rather stay at a more well known brand. This is not a Marriott, rather a Motel 6 with upgraded flooring.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Shelter Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SunshineGirl916
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shelter Hotel for almost a week and loved it. We did notice many of the things that people have stated before: we had to double park every night, the rooms weren't exactly like the sterilized ones you see at most chain hotels, you can hear noise from the street and the upstairs neighbors, and there's no place to hang your wet towel (which was fairly odd). It's a very simplistic place and that's what we grew to love about it. The room was clean, the staff friendly (I had no issues with leaving my keys with them at night), and the street was fairly quite by the time we got to bed--we even slept with the windows open all night! The hotel is located in a residential neighborhood in Koreatown and it felt like a safe area. Everything we wanted to see was pretty much within a three mile distance, which was really nice--we didn't have to spend the whole afternoon stuck in traffic on the freeway or driving around the city. Plus, it was nice to have the free WiFi (though it was a bit slow) and parking! The place does have it's flaws, but it seems like they're always actively improving on it and are willing to go the extra mile to fix any issues you have with your stay. We will definitely stay again the next time we're in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, but far from great.”
Reviews.Author: Henry1981
Reviews.Content: Ok location (if you have a car) Not that much within walking distance around the hotel. Rooms were nice with a good bed, but without any of the things you would normally expect to find in a regular hotel room. No fridge (or icebucket), no hairdryer etc. I would not recommend it for couples on vacation, but for short business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great crash for the 4th”
Reviews.Author: superchillthing
Reviews.Content: We went there for the 4th of July weekend. It was really good. Comfy beds, cute, cozy bathroom with detached shower and bath. I really liked the decor. You can't beat if for the price. The staff was really nice and there's free wireless and parking (apparently a major jewel in LA, lol). Loved it !!! Really cute. We'll totally come back if I'm in LA again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pet-friendly hotel. Love it !”
Reviews.Author: HelloWorld_11
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. It is really well located right by the train with a plethora of restaurants nearby within walking distance. They are pet-freindly. The staff is really fun and cool. Very nice and helpful. There is free parking and if you double park you can just leave your keys at the front desk and they will take care of it for you. The beds are comfortable and there's free wireless. It's in a residential area in Koreatown and it's quiet. Really great stay for the money. Love it !

Reviews.Title: “Cheap. And it shows.”
Reviews.Author: hahn74
Reviews.Content: Don't be deceived by the pictures. This place is pretty dirty and not maintained very well. Stains and cracking paint in the bathroom ceiling as well as a pretty filthy bathroom floor. Scant furniture and some rooms didn't even have a closet or wardrobe. My room couldn't shake a musty odor. The shower water pressure was never stronger than a drizzle and the sink was quickly backed up. I napped one afternoon, presumably when the maids were cleaning our floor. Too bad because they never came back again. The parking lot is full at night but you can double park if you leave the keys at the front desk. Careful though. One friend left his keys overnight and found major scuff marks under his front spoiler the next morning. It's cheap. You get what you pay for. or not even that much.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist”
Reviews.Author: wesleywoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2011 for 3 nights. As others have stated, this hotel is in Korea Town, which means lots of good food around the area (if you're into Asian cuisines). The location of the hotel itself is within a residential neighbourhood which, for a big city like LA, seems safe as we walked back at night. It might be a different story if you were walking by yourself. First, I will explain how the rooms are set up so I make a bit of sense. There are rooms which face outwards towards the street. There are also rooms opposite of those which face the inside. There is basically a hole in the middle of the building so the rooms facing inwards get sunlight. We got one of the rooms on the inside so there isn't a view whatsoever. On the bright side, rooms facing inwards are probably less noisy than rooms facing the street. The rooms are clean and basic. The one thing that did bother me was the lack of somewhere to put your towel in the bathroom after you've finished with it. Most hotels have hooks on the back of the door at the bare minimum. Also, a couple decorative pieces such as a photo or something would give the room a better feel. Other than that, the bed is comfortable and there's a TV with many channels. There is only one elevator in the building so it could take some time. Also, it feels a bit unsafe as it's quite old so we just took the stairs most of the time. The parking garage is free which is a nice bonus... but it's very small. You are allowed to double park but you have to leave your keys with the front desk. We got back late one night and there were no more spots. Luckily we found a spot on the street in front of the building so we didn't have to deal with double parking. Service was good, but the cleaners wore street clothes which is a bit odd. Who knows if they actually work there or not? Or maybe I'm just watching too many movies. Overall, there is no wow factor at this hotel, but for the price, you get what you pay for. If coming to LA again, I would look into Shelter Hotel again, but consider other options as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price - could use a few extra things”
Reviews.Author: jcl12
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for 3 nights in May. We booked the hotel for its price and its location. The room was spacious but minimal. There was still plenty of space for perhaps a dresser of some sort to put our clothes. The bed is comfortable, although out of the four pillows we were given, each of them were a too high; some variation in pillows would have been appreciated. The washroom was nice and clean but could have used a rack on the wall to leave our towels. Situated in Korea town, the hotel is located within walking distance of many restaurants, many of which are open late in case you check-in late as we did. The hotel is surrounded by many residential buildings, and despite a few earlier reviews, the area felt safe and was not loud. The only thing I would advise for future travelers is to request a room on the top floor. Our room was on the second floor, and we were woken in the morning by the people above us. We could hear them stomping and moving about late at night and early in the morning. It was an annoyance, but I figured we could tolerate it since we were only staying for 3 days. The staff was friendly and the hotel has free parking which locks its gates after midnight (1 AM I believe). The hotel was great for the price and if they work on a few things, I would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel, with a minimum of necessities”
Reviews.Author: Viktor01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably an old hostel. The room was alright, but the door was kinda crappy, leaving a two inch gap to the floor. Otherwise clean, really kind and helpful staff. AND two big thumbs up for the free parking in the garage.

Reviews.Title: “First and last time”
Reviews.Author: Debs_V0
Reviews.Content: And this for a couple of reasons: - the noise: 24/7, people walking and talking in the hallway, the elevator, people in the room above you who walk around all night, the air-conditioning outside, every little noise on the street (It looks like a calm neighbourhood, but it definitely isn't). You'd think they'd isolate the rooms better... I think we slept for about 2 hours every night. - the elevator that doesn't work properly and gets stuck on your floor trying to close the doors every 5 seconds - no hair-dryer - no alarm clock - no shelves for your clothes - a dirty flour

Reviews.Title: “So pleased with this find”
Reviews.Author: Jasonstevens
Reviews.Content: Ok, so Korea Town might seem like an odd place to stay when you are in LA but I can tell you that you won't find a nicer boutique hotel in the whole town. Our room was huge, the bathroom was huge and clean, the staff were friendly and helpful and the neighbourhood felt safe. It should be even better when the restaurant and bar open up. Thanks guys, for making our stay in LA so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem close to downtown attractions”
Reviews.Author: TiffneyLamont
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during an event weekend (NBA All Star) and cound't have asked for a better location. The hotel was located just outside of downtown in Korea town in a friendly residential neighborhood. If you are looking for 5 star amenities, don't stay here. But if you are looking for a recently updated, clean, hotel with free parking and close to downtown, I would highly reccomend the hotel. Centrally located, we were able to get to several areas of LA with little to no fuss even during the event weekend. Close to Beverly Center, Staples Center, Downtown LA, and only minutes from Hollywood. Now has become one of my favorite Boutique hotels...Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It, Adored It, So Happy I Found the Shelter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelcricket
Reviews.Content: I have had a chance to look over a few of the reviews. I want to start out my review by saying that I travel quite a bit to Los Angeles. I almost always stay at the same 2 properties in West Hollywood. I happened to be joy riding one day and I wound up running into The Shelter Hotel. I have to argue that although the hotel is listed as being in "Koreatown" in my opinion it is not in the heart of this section. In fact, it is heading to the West Hollywood border. Nevertheless, I saw the hotel and thought it maybe a condominium. In fact, there were several condominiums and nice homes in the area. The neighborhood is VERY safe. In fact, I am surprised at some of the comments. The hotel is in a very eclectic and nice residential neighborhood. You do see a lot of Korean restaurant and shops. Is this why people say these things? To be honest, I thought I had cancelled my reservation. I called and spoke to Jason the GM and I was stunned to find out, I still had a reservation in the system. Jason, went over and beyond helping me. I felt very comfortable speaking to him. I also enjoyed working with Steve, one of the nicest front desk reps that you ever want to meet. I have to say that the rooms are so spacious, especially for the price. I felt like I was in an apartment. My best friend Tawanna adored the property too. The rooms were gorgeous. Simple, and clean. The bathroom was very nice. I loved the hard wood floors. I am not a fan of carpet (especially since I have bad allergies) so walking into a room with gorgeous dark wood floors, was truly a BONUS! There was not ONE moment that I did not feel safe in this neighborhood. The staff provided one-on-one service, and I realized how important that was to me. I am a big fan of customer service and you cannot always receive that at the larger hotels. It felt awesome not being 'just a number'. One of the other things I loved, was the outer decor of the hotel. I love the brownstone effect and the pink crest logo on the building. It was this that caught my eye, on my joy ride that day. I loved the coziness, warmth and relaxing components that the Shelter Hotel provides. I do not have one bad thing to say about the Shelter Hotel. In fact, I found a place to get my nails done. Went food shopping for a few items. All in the same neighborhood. Now, it may not have anything you can walk to, but I had a rental car, and would rather drive where I need to go. The parking garage was fine. I do not know many places you can go to where parking is complimentary. The parking garage is very secure. There were BMWs, Mercedez Benz's, Infiniti's and many other cars in the garage. Economy, Mid Size and Luxury. SUVs also. There is a gate after a certain time of night that closes so no one can enter the parking garage that should not be there. I only have small recommendations: It would be great to have a cocktail hour offered at the Shelter Hotel. Add a DJ for that daily cocktail hour (offering five or six specialty cocktails) would add to this hip spot! It would also be nice to have a breakfast cafe where guests can pay for french pastries and other hot breakfast foods. I know that the hotel is decorating the rooms more... the rooms look great, but it would be nice to see that same brown background and pink crest logo on a bathroom carpet (smile). Maybe a small spa and a swimming pool (lap pool). I would give the Shelter Hotel a standing ovation! I can tell you that anytime I visit LA, I will not stay anywhere else but @ the Shelter.

Reviews.Title: “Very Personal”
Reviews.Author: Edmonds069
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at The Shelter on February 17-February 21, 2011 and I am not too sure where others who have reviewed this hotel has stayed. I have stayed in various hotels over the years some big and some small and I have found that the "boutique hotels" are the ones that treat you like a person as oppose to what you paid for a room/suite. The personal and friendly service we received was unbelievable. Jason Scharlau, the general manager was much more then that, he made you feel like you were family. I have never met him before our stay but you would have thought I was a regular visitor, even maybe a resident, which is not something you'd find in a larger establishment. Great customer service is one of the things I know I look for when I travel because it makes you feel like it was worth the money, no matter the amount and I will say that the rates were exceptional and completed complimented the service. Steve rocked with the quick draw on the direction requests, along with anything locally you needed to find! This is definitely a spot on the come up and I know my best friend and I will go along for the ride, because we can not wait to see what they do next to try to top their exceptional service!!!! The location is very city which is great if you want to walk and get to things, which being from a big city myself, was another great highlight! Centrally located to everything. I was very pleased with my stay at The Shelter and will do it again anytime I'm in the Los Angeles area, which may be sooner then I think!!!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Maybe Halfway there but still a long way away”
Reviews.Author: northernk
Reviews.Content: First off this Hotel is under constant renovation. None of the rooms appear completed. Neighbour hood is not great in that nothing is in walking distance, bad considering the poor parking conditions. When arrived given a room in which a guest was still checked in, lucky thing they were not in the room when we walked in and found their luggage. The check in is from the incomplete second floor still under renovation, a strange feeling as you go up from the ground floor parking garage to check in in an under construction second floor room off the extremely loud and obnoxious elevator. When we were moved to another room, the room looks incomplete, nice wood floor was not properly cleaned, which was told was consistent with another room when speaking to another guest. As a matter of fact it's a shame that the entire room was so poorly maintained and cleaned, nothing looked dusted. Dust from construction ? I don't know but it's not good. Some of the renovation has potential but right now, it's not worth the slightly lower price. No place in the room to hang any clothes either. And then there is the garage, no where to park on the street and not enough spots to park all the cars, so you have to double park, and leave your keys at the desk and trust the crew to move around cars all morning to get people back out of the garage. Sure it's free parking, a revelation in LA, but now you know why, seems like a huge risk for the hotel to be driving these cars around without any written agreement declaring who is responsible for what. Otherwise, the room was fine. If you are willing it put up with the parking, the oddity of the front desk situation, and the cleaning style of the the rooms, it may be worth the decent rates, they offer at this point for this area. It does feel odd staying there though. Oh and no ice machine or for that matter any machines. No frig in room to make up for this either.

Reviews.Title: “Very minimal Facilities. Hotel location not bad.”
Reviews.Author: clhh12
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from 15Jan'11 to 20Jan'11. Very disappointed at the guy with the Afro hairstyle at the check in counter. I worked till 3 or 4am the previous night cos i was on night shift & hoped that i could get an early check-in. When i turned up at the hotel at 12pm after arriving from the airport, i was told the rooms were fully booked the day before and that the room was not ready. Well, i guess i wasn't lucky enough to check in at 12pm. Nevertheless I was told to leave my name with the hotel and they will call me back. When i penned my cell phone & my last name "LEE" on a make shift rough paper they gave me, the afro hair guy said LEE WHO? He should at least said "Sir, can you please leave your full name please". It was rude. When i returned at 230pm, he said, "I haven't call you yet. Wait till 3pm." Which hotel takes 4 hours from the checkout timing of 11am to prepare just a room? I ended up felling asleep for 30mins waiting in my car in the carpark beneath the hotel because i was way too tired. When i went back up to the hotel at 320pm, he was not longer there. The guy at the counter, Steve, was more polite, thanking me for my patience. Had it not been Steve who was more polite, i would have changed hotel. I have been to various part of the country averaging at least 5 different hotels a year and that afro hair guy was probably the most rude ones i've met. A counter staff is the representative of the hotel because that is probably the 1st and the last person one would meet in the hotel. The last time i check the hotel name was Shelter Hotel & not Shelter Motel. It was my 1st ever visit to LA and i chose Shelter hotel because i had an horrible experience with Bed Bugs in Salt Lake City, Utah. I usually preferred new or refurbished hotels. But even though the room was big and i loved the wooden floors which was refreshing and different from most carpetted hotels, the room would really requires a table lamp, a hair dryer, maybe not put the towels beneath the sink, a fridge, a safe, more lighting and maybe a proper closet. The restroom would require a couple more hooks for clothings as well. The free internet was fast. The free underground carpark was small and i was told to park at the handicap slot when i returned late at night which was fine to me. I had to call to open the gate bcos i turn up at 12am plus at night. But it was nice knowing the cars were protected behind locked gates. Lastly, not forgetting the housekeeping left a big bottle of floor cleaner solution on the desk table as a surprise when i came back late at night (I did left a tip on the bed, probably it's not enough?) I'm usually tolerant & not choosy & i knew the hotel was in the midst of renovation, but judging by what i experienced and unless new pictures of facilities were added, i would not recommend the hotel to my friends in near future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs.”
Reviews.Author: wel0ve2vacati0n
Reviews.Content: We were sweetly surprised by the hotel. The hotel is simple and perfect for our needs. We love to come to LA to see family and friends while eating great Korean food. We usually end up staying in downtown LA or near LAX to find the right accommodations but Shelter Hotels met our needs. After reading the reviews, we decided to try it out. The free parking and free Wi-Fi was a plus. The room was just perfect for our needs. We didn't need much but a nice clean room to sleep. Yes, the hotel is still under enovation but it's a great work in progress place to stay. I'm sure the smaller details will be worked out in time. The front desk was very helpful and accommodating to our questions and requests. You can walk two blocks to a mall and several restaurants to eat. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “hotel could not be faulted - location not the best though....”
Reviews.Author: ro_reeve5
Reviews.Content: service excellent rooms huge, clean and lovely bathroom minimal amenities but great for the price nice decor only thing would be that as two young females from the UK the area felt a little unsafe..... couple of incidents with police etc when at 7-Eleven and MacDonalds close by. with hindsight not suitable for those travelling without a car (as we were unfortunately) - good public transport thou.

Reviews.Title: “Shelter Hotel: A Great Economical Stay in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Kelly_RAustin_TX
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Los Angeles to board a Mexican Riviera cruise, and decided to go a few days early to see the sights in LA. We booked our room online for $89/night. Judging by the photos, it seemed like a great deal and close to some of the things we wanted to do and see. We arrived at about 11:00 am on a Thursday morning, and the manager / owner was nice enough to let us check in early. Shelter has a gated parking garage underneath the hotel, which is great. It isn't staffed 24/7, but they'll give you the number for the night guy to call if you get in late, and he'll come down and open the gate for you. That worked out fine. Shelter is VERY conveniently located in the Koreatown section of Los Angeles. The neighborhood is very clean, quiet and safe, and we quickly discovered that the nearby W. 3rd Street will take you virtually anywhere in the city you need to go while avoiding the dreaded freeways--sweet! Our room was on the 3rd floor. The room itself was great. Shelter is NOT the corporate-business travel hotel you're used to. The room is a good size for two, with plenty of room for the king bed, the nightstands, the desk...and that's it. No chair, no dresser, not even any art on the walls. Minimalist, uncluttered. I like it. When you first get to Shelter, you realize right away that they are still doing some clean up work and renovations, as there is the occasional bundle of wires here, a hole in the stairwell where some pipes used to be there. And a lot of construction dust in our room. Now mind you, this is not a huge deal to us--we live with dogs, and are usually covered head-to-toe with dog hair, so a little dust doesn't bother us a bit. But the room was dusty, so dusty we could write our names in the layers on the nightstands. The only other minor gripe I had was with the cleanliness of the bathroom floor. There was a definitive 'muddy footprint trail' between the marble threshold (also muddy) and the bathtub, where you could see that the grout on the rest of the floor was white, but here was dark gray and black. My white socks turned black after one trip to the bathroom. Also, our bedsheets were very clean, but as we were packing on our last day I noticed a stain at the bottom of our comforter. Even though I knew that housekeeping came every day we were there, it just felt a little like they didn't pay attention to detail very well. All of the staff we encountered during our 3-day stay were fantastic: friendly, knowledgable about the area and had great recommendations for us tourists. The lobby had a little plate of donuts and fresh coffee each morning and stacks of local papers, which gave us a lot of great ideas for stuff to do. Oh, free wi-fi too, which is great. The hotel itself was VERY quiet, even though it was a packed house the last two nights we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable price, undergoing improvement”
Reviews.Author: roaming-wifi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights in late June 2010. At that time the place didn’t feel finished. The room was huge and clean, but it was hardly furnished apart from the bed. The air con worked fine and the room was clean and quiet. The hotel is in a residential area. Maybe I missed something but there wasn’t much around the area. We drove to look at other places rather than staying close to the hotel. But for $100US a night, with parking inclusive, it was a more than reasonable place to stay. It will be really nice once they put the finishing touches on it.

Reviews.Title: “Think Boutique, W Hotel--a great find, and one place that I'll always stay when in Southern California...”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler11111
Reviews.Content: Wow--what a hidden jewel. I kinda wondered upon this hotel as it kept emerging in various online searches for unique and reasonably priced hotels in LA.....The Shelter fits that description perfectly.....they took and old Days Inn and converted it into this really cool minimalist style hipster hotel (like a boutique "W" hotel) and priced it properly. My stay here has been perfect in every way......location is perfect, in a quiet neighborhood but only a few blocks from Wilshire....all kinds of shops, restaurants, entertainment, etc....few minutes from hollywood, west hollywood, beverly hills, silverlake. People are excellent---friends, helpful, and offered to help in a variety of ways. I can be a hotel snob at times......but this hotel meets all my criteria-----great service, clean room (the room was perfect), close to the action.....just a week blocks off of Wilshire......and priced reasonably......especially for the short amount of time I acutually spend IN the hotel. I hope the price point stays the same.....because if so.....this will be my hotel of choice EVERYTIME I come to LA. ......oh--forgot to mention, they are in the process of building a full service restaurant, pool, and a few other additional amenities. So I'm sure the next time I visit LA......I'll have even better things to say about this hotel. Simply.....the very best out there for the price point. Thank you Shelter Hotel management and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: BoDiggz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the Halloween weekend last month and all I have to say is "wow!" Upon my arrival, a very warm front desk agent checked me in and had me escorted to my room in no time. The room was nice and included all the amenities that you'd expect from a hotel of this calibur but they had taken the time to welcome my girl with a beautiful boquet for our anniversary. We had a great night out on the town(lot's of great restaurants in the neighborhood) and slept great that night in the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Miracle Mile...”
Reviews.Author: Riccilli
Reviews.Content: What to some may seem like an unusual location, proved to be just the opposite. A mile from downtown, a few miles from Los Feliz, Silverlake, and La Brea. This comfortable, reasonable, well appointed year-old boutique hotel proved to be a perfect launch pad for any activity on this side of town. It is close to the 101 and the 10, so there was no problem getting anywhere else either. Great staff. Dog-friendly. Free Parking. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Location and Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Saintlysinner83
Reviews.Content: We Just back from a trip it the US. Our final stop was in LA. we stayed at the Shelter because it was cheap in comparison to other hotels and the location was great! The name of the hotel at first did put me off. But when we arrived, we were promptly checked it. they had an underground car park which was a great bonus. The room itself was very clean and modern. However it does need a few things to make it look a bit more finished and homely. I can't praise the staff at this hotel enough. they are SO friendly and always take the time out to help you out. One of the girls working there- Tango, was fab. she was so helpful and recommended a fantastic Thai restaurant (it's the best Thai food I have had, outside Thailand). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good to know that Fine Service can still be found in LA”
Reviews.Author: jerrysamaniego
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at the Shelter Hotel close to downtown Los Angeles. I was only looking for a place to stay for the night that was affordable and had a convenient location. What I found was a style of service long forgotten. I felt like I was at home. From the front desk (Steve) to the GM (Jason) I was always made to feel comfortable and in fact I was late for my date because of the comfort I felt in the lobby with simple conversation. The hotel is still developing its image and I cant wait to return when they have finished thier remodeling and upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe, Sparse rooms, strange set up...Checked out 3 days early!”
Reviews.Author: lizmart
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed by the hotel photos when we looked at this hotel; but were really disappointed when we got there. The hotel was in an unfinished state...unconnected electric wires, a pool that looked like it hasn't ever been filled with water. The reception is on the first floor, accessed by a lift with no security beyond that floor, so anyone can just get in the lift and roam around the hotel!! The door to the roof doesn't exist which is incredibly dangerous. The rooms are huge but only have a bed and desk...no chair or drawers, decorating was still to be done, our door didn't lock properly from the inside and due to the loud strange banging noises we heard at night made us feel unsafe so after 2 nights here we checked out early. As an Interior Designer I would pose this hotel as being unsafe and falsely advertised, a real disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty bed, floors, and sink - but nothing else exists”
Reviews.Author: CalifDoc
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at USC and most nearby hotels were booked. The photos looked nice and the reviews were pretty good and seemed to give the impression this hotel wasn't finished. It isn't - but unfortunately, I think it will stay this way. I got into the area and called for directions because I was misdirected by Mapquest. The young woman who was the only person there didn't really understand me and I couldn't understand her. In the garage, you are warned that cars may be double parked. That made me nervous since I had an early morning meeting. The photo of the bed is accurate. It is a beautiful bed and the wood floor is gorgeous (although I doubt if it had been swept in a week or two) and the bathroom sink is stylish. I checked and found no bedbugs. The good things. Now the bad. I was hungry and thirsty. After asking I was told that I could walk to several Korean restaurants (the receptionist couldn't tell me the names because I don't speak Korean). I decided to order pizza. The hotel has no soda machine, no ice, no cold water. The pizza was cold and the soda was warm. Then the beautiful flat screen TV didn't work - so she moved me to another room. The TV worked, but you have to put your hand at a very awkward position to change channels because the Direct TV receiver is glued to the back of the TV. There was no comfortable chair in the room. The only place for towels was on a shelf under the sink. Not a single hook or towel bar to be found anywhere. There was a great view of the dumpsters from both rooms I was in at different ends of the hotel. In the morning I got up very early because I was worried about the parking situation and jumped in the shower. I got out - and guess what -- no hair dryer. When was the last time you stayed in a hotel without a hair dryer? I had to wait for someone to bring it up. I'll be canceling the reservation for the second meeting next month.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just need to finish it”
Reviews.Author: minicooperdownunder
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in April 2010, the hotel is located in a nice mainly residential area but only two or three blocks from busy Wilshire Blvd in an area known as Korea Town. The hotel at the time had an odd lobby situation up on the second floor I think it was and really only a desk and a few chairs, not really a hotel lobby, but it did the job and I think it is one of the still to be completed renovation projects along with the swimming pool. The room was very stylish with dark timber floors and furniture and pale coloured walls which gave it a bit of a designer look, but a little impractical as there was virtually no storage space. There was a small open closet with some hangers and a shelf above it but no drawer space at all apart from a very tiny one in the desk which was barely big enough for an ipod let alone any clothing. In addition to a lack of furniture there was absolutely nothing in the room to give you any guide to the hotel, no guide to the TV or phone, not even which extension was the front desk, nothing about the local area not even that little card that is on the back of every hotel door with the room rates and the hotel liability policy or a guide to where the fire escapes were. The room had a great LCD TV with a good selection of stations, very comfortable king size bed with great linens and nice towels and the bathroom had been renovated nicely. Parking was free when I stayed there but I think is usually $10 per night, but like a lot of motels in Los Angeles there just isn’t enough spaces to cope with the number of guests and the hotel allows cars to be parked behind already parked cars and they keep the keys and move the cars if needed, not an ideal situation if you are in a hurry to leave. Staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful and one even lent me his cell phone to make a call which couldn’t be made from the room which was much appreciated. Good strong reliable wifi internet free in the room. I paid US $63 per night which I think for Los Angeles is a good deal, I just think they need to finish the rooms to make them truly nice and yes I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, modern and quirky hotel in cool neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: aamirrodriguez
Reviews.Content: The Shelter Hotel is in what seems to have been an apartment complex converted into a hotel. The hotel was very comfortable and had ultra-modern decorations and furniture. The staff was laid-back, helpful, and friendly. There was free on-site parking, which was hard to find in LA. The location itself was convenient (between Downtown and Hollywood) given that we were driving, although it was only a few blocks from the Wilshire/Normandie metro stop. The only annoying thing was a few kids hanging out front (from the apartments next door), but they didn't prove to be too much of a nuisance. Over-all, a great experience, and I would return. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, most comfy bed on the planet, sparse rooms, interesting & safe location, helpful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: amdandrea
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was friendly, fast and informative with good recommendations on places to eat, how to get to places, etc. Location was nice - right in Koreatown - surrounded by great Korean restaurants, bars, clubs and fantastic bakeries. Safe and clean neighborhood. Walked around during the day and in the middle of the night without issue or feeling nervous. Just a 5 minute walk to the metro was very convenient. Rooms had little furniture (no bureau) but as we didn't stay long, we didn't need any. Furniture that was in the room was really nice, dark wood, modern, matched the hardwood floors in each room. Would definitely stay again if ever in LA. Can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “If this is the location you want-Hotel is very nice.”
Reviews.Author: cpapat
Reviews.Content: We were visiting my son who lives near here. Some people say the area is not nice, but I don't think it is bad. Since we could walk to our sons apartment in 20 minutes from the hotel, this is the area we were looking for. The hotel is in amongst lots of apartments, but a couple of blocks from here is Wilshire with a metro stop and lots of businesses. The fact that the hotel has free parking is great. The rooms are very nice, although the 1st room we got did not have working air conditioning. We asked to be moved and we were put in another room right away with great air conditioning. The rooms are very clean and neat. The hotel seemed to be very quiet at night, although they are still doing some construction at the hotel and we could hear hammering in the afternoon. All in all, if you are familar with the location or know you want to stay in this area, the hotel is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Uneven Experience”
Reviews.Author: vinividivori
Reviews.Content: I'm a native Angeleno that recently moved out of state - but love any excuse to get back "home". I had been at a conference in LA earlier in the week - and decided to expend my trip by four additional days to catch up with friends and basically hang out. I've stayed at a number of different budget boutique hotel/motels over the past few years - and try to find a decent place that is around 100 per night or less. I booked my room through their website - and got an introductory price of around 70.00 per night, I think because they're still working on renovating parts of the property, like the pool. When I arrived, they graciously allowed me to check in early - as I had just checked out of my conference hotel downtown. The front desk person gave me the scoop on how their FREE parking worked - first come first served - if you block somebody in you have to leave your keys at the front desk - you need to call the front desk to be buzzed in after mid-night. The neighborhood is residential - but not great to walk around at night by yourself. A number of pretty aggressive panhandlers around bumming change when you get closer to the stores and shops in the area - but not near the hotel. (Some of the beautiful churches on Wilshire Blvd are good samaritanas and run food / shower programs for the homeless). That said - there are some great Korean BBQ / Pho places in the 'hood! My room was just like what was pictured on their website (and here on Tripadvisor). Modern, sleek and roomy! The bed was clean and comfy - but my room had some weird staining on the walls underneath the window - as if there had been a leak. Due to this the room smelled a little musty. When I opened the windows I noticed one window had a screen, the other one didn't. I was on the top floor - so I didn't worry about it. The bathroom was modern and sleek as well - but not as clean as I had hoped. When I got the shower curtain wet - it smelled like mildew and had orangey rust/mildew stains on it. A little bleach should take care of that - but something the management should keep an eye out for. The only weird thing was one afternoon I was just kicking it in my room - enjoying their FREE internet (which was great) - and suddenly, with no warning one of the workmen in the hotel opened my door to change the door latch plate on the doorjamb. No knocking or anything! Lucky I was alone! And clothed! Check out was smooth - no problems, except that was when I found out about the complimentary breakfast! No one had mentioned it when I checked in :( Overall an OK stay - but I wouldn't stay here if the price were any higher...

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: JMwatsama
Reviews.Content: We had two pleasant nites at the Shelter Hotel, LA. It's location is just about midway between downtown LA and West Beverly hills, so ideal as a base loction for travelling to either. Alex was on duty when we arrived and he was very welcoming, polite and helpfull suggested a number of restaurants and bars for us to check out in downtown LA and West Beverly Hills. The decor of our room was very modern, clean, chic and surprisingly spacious. Comfortable and equipped well for the price you pay for the room. If you are the sort of traveller that just wants a comfortable affordable room in a good location but prefer to eat out (breakfast, lunch dinner etc) then this hotel is for you. Rather ingeniously, every morning there is a selection of doughnuts and fresh coffee at the reception, but get up early to avoid the sugar rush! We missed out on the first day so the following morning Jason reserve the remaining 4 for us! Yay!! It does not have a restaurant or any of the other gimmicks that other hotels might have but, it doesn't pretend to be anything more and this is reflected in the price and it has free sheltered parking (no pun intended). We really enjoyed our stay and I must say that the manager, Jason, was very knowlegable on the area of LA and extremely helpful. Thanks for the suggestion of the Griffith Observatory Jason! We would just like to say thanks to both Jason and Alex for their hospitality. The Shelter Hotel LA certainly gets our thumbs up and we would certainly recommend it. Josh and Elena Mwatsama

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Large Room and Great Price”
Reviews.Author: wusquito
Reviews.Content: I flew to LA on the 2nd June 2010. I was only staying one night in LA but wanted something close to Hollywood so that I could see some of the sights in the limited time I had. I collected my hire car from Dollar and it was only a 15 minute drive to the hotel. The free parking was under the hotel which seemed very secure. The check in was fast and straight forward as I have booked online before hand. The hallways were clean and smoke free. The room itself was huge, measuring around 17' x 17' with a newly fitted bathroom. The bath was a good size and the shower had a very good pressure. The location is residential and very close to Korea Town. Plenty of local shops and food outlets. I didn't see any signs of trouble or any people hanging around. I also drove from the hotel to Hollywood and it took around 15 mins (this was around 8pm) so the traffic may be worse during the day. Overall I can't fault the hotel. Good location, great price, great room. Will definitely return on my next visit to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome boutique hotel - Hotel Manager Jason was top notch!”
Reviews.Author: hitchinhiker
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. Well situated in Koreatown in mid-town Los Angeles. My room was quiet, spacious, trendy and clean with a nice sized, flat-screen satellite tv (and a remote control that worked!). Cleaning staff were polite, courteous and attentive. Hotel Manager Jason was absolutely excellent in all manner of hotel operations, customer service and attention to detail in making guests feel valued and welcome. He spent more than a few minutes answering my questions and providing a wealth of information on restaurant options, the LA music scene and how to get various points of interest in the City . His professionalism and kindness made my already excerllent stay that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - nothing fancy, but everything we needed.”
Reviews.Author: Juechel
Reviews.Content: Positive: - Great location, quite central but in a quiet street. - Great service, basic but very helpful and quick. - Awesome bed. King size and very comfy! - Free parking! - Free internet! - Very good rate - we paid around $70 per night. Negative (but didn't really bother me): - It seems like they just renovated at least parts of the hotel. The interior was very spartanic, no pictures or decoration in the rooms. Again, didn't bother me really... - Tried, but can't think of anything else.... Good value!

Reviews.Title: “Smart décor and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: OzAsh7614
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights at the beginning of the month and we were pleased with the accommodations. The bed was large and comfortable and everything was very clean. Staff were very friendly and helpful when we had queries about places to go and transport. It's in a good location close to restaurants, buses and trains. Only downside was that the expedia site stated the rooms had a microwave and refrigerator which was incorrect. I understand that Expedia got it wrong but I had emailed the hotel and they informed me that they only had a few and would note that I require them on my reservation however when I arrived the gentleman at the desk said they had none. This was not a serious bother though. I enjoyed my stay here and can't wait for the renovations to finish (they are building a pool, restaurant and bar) as I will definitely be back. Oh and prices were fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place for a super price.”
Reviews.Author: kate35805
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay for 4 nights at the Shelter Hotel. The rooms were brand new, with super comfy beds, and were styley and modern. The staff was friendly and helpful, was in a good location, central to Hollywood, Downtown, and Beverly Hills. The hotel was quiet and lovely. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service. Friendly Professional Staff. Great Experience.”
Reviews.Author: J_Harvard
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this to anyone visiting the Los Angeles area (business or pleasure). Friendly and professional staff that is and eager to make your stay a great one. Management was helpful and made very good recommendations for restaurants, landmarks, cool places to see etc. The room's decor is very fresh and inviting. Nice job on the attention to details. Super comfortable bed and roomy space. All around great. Will stay there again and I highly recommend the Shelter Hotel in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “What A NIGHTMARE!”
Reviews.Author: Jackyl01
Reviews.Content: All I can say is, "WOW"! Don't stay here with your dogs unless you want the LAPD knocking at your door! I booked a room through Orbitz for a one night stay at the Shelter Hotel in Los Angeles. From the website, it looked like an okay spot for one night, and they take pets, so their website says... Well, after a grueling 3 1/2 hour in Friday traffic in L.A., we were ready to get into our room, and decompress for 10 minutes before we had to get ready to head out for our event. But...not so fast! We were, rudely, informed upon check-in that they had no record of our reservation. I thought that was interesting, since I was holding the confirmation letter from Orbitz in my hand. Well, a quick check-in it was not, but no problem; we worked it out, and the hotel did offer to give us a better rate for our trouble. We proceeded to unload the car, hustle our gear, ourselves, and our dogs up to the room. Well, after a long drive, no doubt everyone needed to relieve themselves, dogs included! We took the dogs out front to pee, and after returning to the room, get a phone call from Rick, at the front desk. He proceeds to inform us that we can't have our dogs there because they are over 20 lbs. If we want to stay, we are going to have to pay another $60! Well, I was shocked, as nowhere in any of the literature about the hotel either on Orbitz, or the Shelter's own website was this indicated. All that it says is that they take pets. I told this to Rick, and he went round and round with me. I asked him to simply show me somewhere that a weight limitation was indicated, and he couldn't do it. He then told us if we didn't pay $50, we had to leave. Well, the first time he said $60. Now which was it, $50 or $60? It was really startng to feel like an arbitrary request, as his amount requested, changed. I refused, until he could present me with facts, which I tell him is a reasonable request. Well, then Rick threatens to call the cops, and hangs-up. Now, mind you, we had nowhere else to go at this juncture, it's now after 8:00 p.m., we have an event to attend, and really, how the hell am I going to find another hotel that "takes pets"? I got the phone number of the GM of the hotel, Jason [-], and left him a detailed message hoping to get some kind of assistance with the situation, but to this day have heard nothing from him! We continued getting ready, and 30-40 minutes later, get a knock at the door. It's the LAPD!!!! I am asked out into the hallway, where the police proceed to tell me that they have been requested to remove us from the property! I am really apalled at this point, and state my case. They were very nice, and completely understood my plight. They agreed to mediate the situation, as we had nowhere else to go! So, I am escorted down to the lobby by the LAPD to work something out! Now mind you, kind reader, I am extremely embarassed by this! There are other people in the lobby, and even though I knew that I was in the right, I felt like a real chump! At the desk, Rick was nothing shy of a joke! I asked him, again, to show me something, anything that states that they only take pets that are 20 lbs or less. Again, he can't. I then ask him if they have a scale to weigh pets in on upon arrival, or if he is capable of making a weight judgement by just "eyeballing" it. What do you think his reply was? "Duh..."! I asked him, again, for the phone number of the GM, and also his first and last name. Rick says, "I don't know how to say his last name". I am thinking, "Wow, what kind of Mickey Mouse operation are they running here?". Well, I just want to be over this fiasco, and get on with my night, so the police ask me if I will agree to pay the $50 now, and work on getting reimbursed at a later date. They tell Rick, that if I do this, he must let us stay. I, reluctantly, agree (how easy will it be to get my money back at a later date)? So, apparently, we have reached an agreement, albeit I will try to dispute this at a later date. Rick proceeds to write some chicken-scratch, on a blank piece of paper with a photo-copy of my drivers license about a $50 fee for "not informing the hotel upon check-in that my pets were over 20 lbs________(sign here)"! At this point, I am laughing! They don't even have a pre-made form for this strictly enforced policy? He didn't even use hotel letter-head! Wow, they are really legit! (Please read with a touch of sarcasm)! Well, at this point, the police escorted me back to my room, and gave me their contact information for use at a later date, should I need their testimony for my dispute. The LAPD were, actually, very courteous and helpful. The Shelter Hotel...a total joke. Because of this fiasco, we were late to our engagement, and caused our hosts to be late as well. I have never been treated so poorly, or had such miserable customer service as at the Shelter Hotel. At this writing the GM, JASON [-], has still not attempted to contact me to apologize for the ill treatment we received there. Way to run damage control, Jason! I did talk to the customer service department at Orbitz. They did some research, and found that the Shelter Hotel, did NOT, in any of their literature, post a weight limitation on pets! They were extremely apologetic, and have offered to compensate me with a gift certificate.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant last leg on our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: prof_hoolahan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shelter for the final two nights of our honeymoon before flying out from LAX. Really nice room in the residential area of Koreatown. Free parking is a massive bonus. Area is nice, and the Korean supermarket was fab. Would have been perfect place to stay if they provided self catering facilities. Metro station nearby got us to the Staples Centre in no time to watch the Clippers. Loads of buses nearby also. Staff were very helpful, and was a nice place to wind down before heading back to the UK

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Cheap stay!”
Reviews.Author: SDHawkeye
Reviews.Content: Hotel was cheap compared to what was around. Went to a Lakers game and this was less than a 10 minute drive. Location was great for restaurants and downtown. Wasn't expecting to much but it thoroughly impressed me. When we got there, there was free parking underground and it was gated at night, so that was reassuring. The two downfalls of this hotel is that there isn't much guidance on where to go after you park, as well as the lack of really a professional front desk. Nowhere does it really show you that you need to take the elevator to the second floor to get to the front desk. Once the doors open you're greeted by an open desk with a computer and printer on it with a staff member. Hopefully that's the next thing that's going to be fixed in their renovation, it's not the best first impression. What was nice was the staff, they are very friendly and you can tell the hotel is doing a lot to try and improve the interior. Our room was very nice and upgraded. From nice dark wood floors, to a nice tv with lots of stations to an updated bathroom, this place was very pleasing to the eye. The room was quite large and doesn't have to much within it, so that may something that need to consider upgrading as well. Everything within the room was spotless and clean. The beds felt very comfortable and we were not disturbed all night. I highly recommend this place if you want to stay around downtown, it was a very pleasant surprise and is a good find.

Reviews.Title: “My high expectations were exceeded!”
Reviews.Author: rheo3000
Reviews.Content: The room looks better in person than in the picture (how often does that happen?) The floors are hardwood. The beds are brand new and ridiculously comfortable. The street is quiet, so our sleep was undisturbed and peaceful. The bed is king sized, but it doesn't dwarf the room, my husband and I were able to spread out and get comfortable without getting in each others way. With a car it was easy to get anywhere in the city. The staff was easy to talk to and the few suggestions we had were received receptively. We would stay there again and recommend it to any friends visiting LA.

Reviews.Title: “Totally brilliant for price!”
Reviews.Author: DominicAuckland
Reviews.Content: When booking the Shelter my expectation weren't super high given how cheap it was. Most of the TA reviews were positive so we took a chance. I'm so glad i did. I will never stay anyway else in LA again. The rooms are big, recently and tastefully redecorated, great free internet in room, 1000s of TV channels, super clean, good location in mid-town, great staff , free parking and all this for a totally amazing price. Easily competed with some rooms i'd paid $200 elsewhere. Not 5 star at all but for the price impossible to beat i'd imagine. You'd be crazy to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Still under renovation, but would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Jmcelton
Reviews.Content: Hotel was still under renovation, but for the price it was great. Big room, clean, decor was great. Looks just like the pictures. Staff was very friendly. Worth going back to.

Reviews.Title: “Staff did their best with what they had.”
Reviews.Author: moonkwean
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a state of flux. Renovations are not complete. Rooms large and clean. Location is quiet and near to sightseeing locations. Previous comments are correct. It appears construction done on the cheap to get the place open. If you looking for a inexpensive, central, clean hotel with minimal frills this is the place, Yes, I would return as the staff went out of their way to make our stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again, Unless the Hotel Works Through Its Issues”
Reviews.Author: istriche
