Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel for extended family visiting LA. Been hoping for a good hotel to crop up in the Koreatown area and based on prior tripadvisor reviews decided to try Shelter Hotels. The non-lobby with a small shabby desk on the second floor serves as check-in. You then get into the dark small elevator which opens up to scary dark hallways. The rooms are beyond minimalistic- they are a good size but the size only accentuates how barren and cold they feel. The doors and walls are extremely thin, and nothing seems to fit quite well- flimsy construction. No view. this hotel also seems to serve as a short-term rental as there were interesting people shuffling around the hallways with their dogs, etc. on the weekend, a crowd of screaming sorority-type girls kept everyone up at night. there is only one attendant that mans the "front desk" and the phone, so if you call him to come upstairs and deal with the heat or housekeeping issue no one else will be there to answer other rooms' calls. When we tried calling down to the front desk it rang and rang with no one picking up. It wasn't worth $100 a night to feel unsafe all night. you feel like you're in a bad dream and keep hoping you'll wake up. much better to go down the street to oxford palace.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous gem, modern room with fantastic bed”
Reviews.Author: VitaMinKY
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on Hotels.com and was very surprised at the price. I was suspect that it might be in a dodgy area or something like that. I was very pleasantly surprised, it was easy to find, and was right in the heart of what we wanted to do. Nice quiet neighborhood. They are still working on the renovations, but we were not bothered by noise. The room was a generous size, and the bed was absolutely fantastic, firm yet comfortable. I loved the wood floors too. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in LA!”
Reviews.Author: stacyz76
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was undergoing renovations when we stayed there. It is set in a residential neighborhood with underground parking. The room was great. There was a very soft pillow top bed, working wifi and peace and quiet. The room was very, very clean as was the bathroom. It was scarcely decorated and had a very art deco feel to it. The rooms are up an elevator that lead to the outside with most rooms being in an interior hallway. Due to renovations, we had free underground parking. The WiFi was also free and it was a steal that we got through hotels.com for under 100. the staff was very friendly and helpful and I would pick this Inn above all others if I had to stay in that area of LA again. It was just a short 4 mile drive on surface streets to Cedars Sinai.

Reviews.Title: “review times two.. i stayed here then my parents. Hidden little gem.”
Reviews.Author: lawing5
Reviews.Content: What a great little find... Its a hotel that they have just completly redone... Only one floor is open so far, but believe me you cant beat what they have.. Amazingly comfortable beds.. The rooms are very minimalistic in approach and make you feel quite at home... Its in a neighborhod so is nice and quiet.. easy parking.. My parents stayed here for a week and loved it and they are very picky! Check out Shelter.. Cant wait for em to add the restaurant and bar......

Reviews.Title: “I was extremely impressed”
Reviews.Author: TripTakenMaster
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Los Angeles for a few days, and I found The Shelter on a whim. I was a little hesitant because it wasn't on the beaten path (Hollywood/Sunset). It turns out this hotel is in Korea town, and is the perfect place to stay in L.A. There are tons of restaurants and shops in walking distance, and Downtown is right around the corner. I've been to L.A. before, and downtown was kind of a dump, but they have really made it a scene, and I had a blast at L.A. Live and the bars down there. I will never stay in Hollywood again. The hotel itself is in a neighborhood that was very safe and quite, with plenty of transportation. When I got to the room, I felt like I should have paid $100 more than I did. I couldn't believe how nice it was. Hardwood floors, flat screen with Direct Tv. The bed was and extremely comfortable pillow top mattress, and the bathroom had brand new everything. All and all a great experience, the staff was extremely helpful and friendly, with plenty of suggestions on what to do on a Tues. I will never stay at any other hotel when I visit L.A. It made me want to come back soon. Don't miss out on this new L.A. gem!

HotelInfo.Name: Shelter Hotels Los Angeles
HotelInfo.Address: 457 S. Mariposa Ave., Los Angeles, CA 90020
